title: [Large-scale] Brain-Computer Interface (BCI)-Based Motor Imagery Training Program

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Neuroscience Concepts, Experience with Motor Imagery Training (Not Required)
context.additional_context: Blended education combining smartphone-based BCI tools with offline practical sessions. Emphasizes technical training applicable in conditions resembling learners' daily work environments

learning_goals: Learners can identify changes in brainwave (ERD/ERS) patterns during motor imagery tasks with at least 70% accuracy through three or more BCI feedback sessions
Learners can develop and apply three personalized exercise imagery automation strategies through twice-weekly training over four weeks.
Learners can rate the perceived impact of BCI-based training on motor function improvement at 3.5 points or higher on a 5-point scale in pre-post comparative surveys.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
